intro: Ipomoea repens f. deltoidea, commonly known as the Delta morning glory, is a trailing vine native to tropical regions. It features heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its rapid growth habit makes it both a popular ornamental plant and a potential weed in gardens.
